description.value: A volume of chants to the Morninglord.

The Blade of Truth: The Uses of Logic in the War Against Diabolist Heresies, as Fought by the Ulmist Inquisition

A strange book that mixes logic exercises with lurid descriptions of fiend-worshiping cults.
This is a well crafted book, just waiting for an author to complete it.
An opaque orange to red-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces
A simple unrefined gemstome.
AÂ transparent rich olive green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces
A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.Â
A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

Hail thee of might and valor:

I, the Burgomaster of Barovia, send you honorâwith despair.

My adopted daughter, the fair Ireena Kolyana, has been these past nights bitten by a vampyr. For over four hundred years, this creature has drained the life blood of my people. Now, my dear Ireena languishes and dies from an unholy wound caused by this vile beast. He has become too powerful to conquer.

So I say to you, give us up for dead and encircle this land with the symbols of good. Let holy men call upon their power that the devil may be contained within the walls of weeping Barovia. Leave our sorrows to our graves, and save the world from this evil fate of ours.

There is much wealth entrapped in this community. Return for your reward after we are all departed for a better life.

Kolyan Indirovich
Burgomaster

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
Made from the branch of a Gulthias tree (see the blights entry in the Monster Manual), a Gulthias staff is a spongy, black length of wood. Its evil makes beasts visibly uncomfortable while within 30 feet of it. The staff has 10 charges and regains 1d6 + 4 of its expended charges daily at dusk.

If the staff is broken or burned to ashes, its wood releases a terrible, inhuman scream that can be heard out to a range of 300 feet. All blights that can hear the scream immediately wither and die.

Vampiric Strike. The staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff. On a hit, it deals damage as a normal quarterstaff, and you can expend 1 charge to regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt by the weapon. Each time a charge is spent, red blood oozes from the staffâs pores, and you must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be afflicted with short-term madness (see âMadnessâ in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Masterâs Guide).

Blight Bane. While you are attuned to the staff, blights and other evil plant creatures donât regard you as hostile unless you harm them.
A staff made from the black branch of a tree. This looks... Unwholesome.
A rather mundane looking wand.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: The wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges, and if a secret door or trap is within 30 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you. The wand regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.
This staff feels cool to the touch.

(Requires attunement by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard)

You have resistance to cold damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.RpKjTlYASrfqUPVA]{Cone of Cold} (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{Fog Cloud} (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WN2LWEljYU6QqnRH]{Ice Storm} (4 charges), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fzZnVKLmBMo2f5up]{Wall of Ice} (4 charges).

The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff turns to water and is destroyed.
A green copper ewer embossed with images of dancing bears, elks, and wolves.
A handsome, fur-lined black cloak embroidered with golden thread.
This intricate gold necklace is easily over five centuries old.

This magic weapon has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to release a wave of terror. Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot radius extending from you must succeed on a [[/save wis 15 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of you for 1 minute. While it is &Reference[frightened]{frightened} in this way, a creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If it has nowhere it can move, the creature can use the Dodge action. At the end of each of its turns, a creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The mace regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

unidentified.description: This mace has a head shaped as terrifying skulls.

description.value: This mace has skulls for its head.
A pelt from a decent sized beaver.
This eyepatch is adorned with a carnelian.
A handmade knife made for nefarious purposes.
A beautiful hand-crafted work of art.

This spherical talisman serves as a spellcasting focus, helping the practitioner to channel arcane, primal, or divine energies.

Spellcasting Focus. An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, using it in place of any material component which does not list a cost.
Deed to 101 Old Row.
Deed to the Old Bonegrinder.
An amazing Dwarven mug hammered from pure electum.
A beautiful ivory hairbrush with silver bristles.
Eau de toilette.

macro.name: Really Old Brandy

description.value: This is a fine brandy, but seems to be very very old...
The will is signed by Gustav and Elisabeth Durst and bequeathes the house, the windmill, and all other family property to Rosavalda and Thornboldt Durst in the event of their parentsâ deaths.
A wooden seal bearing the Durst familyâs insignia (a windmill).

(Requires attunement by a Bard)

An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college.Â A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a [[/save wis 15 format=long]] or take 2d4 psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells: Fly, Invisibility, Levitate, Protection from Evil and Good, Animal Friendship, Protection from Energy (&Reference[fire]{fire} only), Protection from &Reference[poison]{Poison}. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it canât be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to beÂ charmed on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a &Reference[somatic]{somatic} or a &Reference[material]{material} component.
This is clearly something very special.

(Requires attunement by a Creature of Good Alignment)

The Icon of Ravenloft is a 12-inch-tall statuette made of the purest silver, weighing 10 pounds. It depicts a cleric kneeling in supplication.

The icon was given to Strahd by the archpriest Ciril Romulich, an old family friend, to consecrate the castle and its chapel.

While within 30 feet of the icon, a creature is under the effect of a protection from evil and good spell against fiends and &Reference[undead]{undead}. Only a creature attuned to the icon can use its other properties.

Augury. You can use an action to cast an augury spell from the icon, with no &Reference[material]{material} components required. Once used, this property canât be used again until the next dawn.

Bane of the &Reference[undead]{Undead}. You can use the icon as a holy symbol while using the Turn &Reference[undead]{Undead} or Turn the Unholy feature. If you do so, increase the save DC by 2.

Cure Wounds. While holding the icon, you can take an action to heal one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. The target regains 3d8 + 3 hit points, unless it is an &Reference[undead]{undead}, a &Reference[construct]{construct}, or a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}. Once used, this property canât be used again until the next dawn.
This is a 12-inch-tall statuette made of the purest silver, weighing 10 pounds. It depicts a cleric kneeling in supplication.

(Requires attunement by a cleric or paladin of good alignment)

The Holy Symbol of Ravenkind is a unique holy symbol sacred to the good-hearted faithful of Barovia. It predates the establishment of any church in Barovia. According to legend, it was delivered to a paladin named Lugdana by a &Reference[giant]{giant} raven â or an angel in the form of a &Reference[giant]{giant} raven. Lugdana used the holy symbol to root out and destroy nests of vampires until her death. The high priests of Ravenloft kept and wore the holy symbol after Lugdanaâs passing.

The holy symbol is a platinum amulet shaped like the sun, with a large crystal embedded in its center.

The holy symbol has 10 charges for the following properties. It regains 1d6 + 4 charges daily at dawn.

Hold Vampires. As an action, you can expend 1 charge and present the holy symbol to make it flare with holy power. Vampires and vampire spawn within 30 feet of the holy symbol when it flares must make a [[/save wis 15 format=long]]. On a failed save, a target is &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect on itself.

Turn &Reference[undead]{Undead}. If you have the Turn &Reference[undead]{Undead} or the Turn the Unholy feature, you can expend 3 charges when you present the holy symbol while using that feature. When you do so, &Reference[undead]{undead} have disadvantage on their saving throws against the effect.

Sunlight. As an action, you can expend 5 charges while presenting the holy symbol to make it shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The light is sunlight and lasts for 10 minutes or until you end the effect (no action required).
A platinum amulet shaped like the sun, with a large crystal embedded in its center.
